Description.val:
This line item funds modifications to the E-6 Mercury aircraft to improve mission capability and readiness.  All sixteen (16) aircraft, unless otherwise noted in the E-6 fleet will receive each modification.  The E-6 is a manned airborne communications platform designed to provide a survivable, endurable, and reliable airborne Command and Control Communications capability in support of the President, Secretary of Defense, and United States strategic and non-strategic forces.  

-Safety Deficiencies (OSIP 008-02) corrects high risk aircraft safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  

-Tech Insertion (OSIP 003-04) corrects aircraft obsolescence, supportability, weight management and interoperability deficiencies through new technology insertion enabling mission readiness and mandate compliance. 

-Service Life Extension Program (OSIP 003-07) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2038+ through airframe strengthening and structural data recording and analysis.  

-Communications Upgrade (OSIP 012-07) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to improve airborne command post operations and integrates commercial wideband Satellite Communication (SATCOM) capability.  

-Block I (OSIP 008-10) corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence. 

-Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (OSIP 013-10) installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.  

-Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) (OSIP 002-12) corrects airborne command post operational test deficiencies by installing an improved APU to meet increased aircraft power requirements.  

-Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals/Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (FAB-T/PNVC) (OSIP 014-14) replaces obsolete Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals with improved FAB-T and replaces Secure Emergency Conferencing Network with PNVC.  

-Mission Systems (OSIP 011-18) corrects mission systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) systems.

Name.val: Kapton Engine Struts A Kits -- Procurement
Kapton Engine Struts A Kits -- Installation

Name.@footnote: Installation will occur as part of MR-TCDL (OSIP 013-10).
Installation Kit NRE in FY18-FY19 is for replacement of Kapton wiring in tail area and emergent safety modifications.

Name.val: FQIS Edge Light Panels B Kits -- Procurement
FQIS Edge Light Panels B Kits -- Installation

Name.@footnote: Other Support cost in FY18-FY22 is for continued support of emergent aircraft safety hazards and Kapton wiring replacement to enable mission readiness.

Remarks.val:
Models of Systems Affected: E-6 Series

DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The Operational Safety Improvement Program corrects safety hazards to protect personnel and equipment enabling mission readiness.  The OSIP also addresses Federal agency directives, aging aircraft material condition, and emergent safety hazards generated by the operational environment.  Modifications include, but not limited to:  Fuel Quantity Indicator System (FQIS) modification, Kapton wiring replacement, and other safety deficiencies that require correction; i.e. Crash Survivable Flight Indicator Recorder System (CSFIRS).

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  FQIS kit buys PY-FY19; installations in PY-FY20.  Aircraft Kapton NRE PY-FY22, buys and installs in PY to beyond FYDP.  Kapton Radome, Wings, Engine Struts, and Tail are included in Kapton replacement efforts.

Models of Systems Affected: E-6 Series

DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Mission Systems corrects mission systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) system integration onto the E-6B.  Integration of already qualified airborne systems will be primary solution sets, but if required the ruggedization of the COTs/GOTs from land or water fielded systems may be pursued.  High Frequency Automatic Link Establishment (HF-ALE) will integrate a DoD common airborne solution.  Mission Operations Monitor (MOM) will update already installed E-6B systems with the ability to monitor and record critical parameters to ensure mission accomplishment and provide for accurate and timely post mission evaluations.  Additional hardware for more robust monitor may be added to the aircraft.  Airborne Launch Control System (ALCS) will integrate an Air Force procured system onto the E-6B to replace the current ALCS which is going obsolete.  Mission Suite Upgrade will address significant wholesale mission system design and obsolescence issues with the requirement to match mission capability though the aircraft service life.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  HF-ALE NRE in FY17-FY18. HF-ALE A kit buys in FY19-to beyond FYDP; B kit buys in FY19-to beyond FYDP; with installs in FY20-to beyond FYDP.  MOM NRE in FY18-FY19. MOM A kit buys in FY19-to beyond FYDP; B kit buys in FY19-to beyond FYDP; with installs in in FY20-to beyond FYDP.  ALCS NRE in FY20-FY21. ALCS A kit buys in FY21-to beyond FYDP; B kit buys in FY21-to beyond FYDP; with installs in FY22-to beyond FYDP.  Mission Suite NRE in FY20-FY21. Mission Suite A kit buys in FY21-to beyond FYDP; B kit buys in FY21-to beyond FYDP; with installs in in FY22-to beyond FYDP.

Name.@footnote: Other support in FY18 includes engineering and logistics support for Cockpit Update, logistics and training. FY19 includes engineering and logistics support for AC Electrical system.

Title.val: Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade A Kits

Name.val: 1.1.5) Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade A Kits - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade A Kits

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Technology Insertion corrects aircraft systems obsolescence, supportability, and interoperability deficiencies through technology insertion of commercial and government off the shelf (COTs/GOTs) system integration onto the E-6B.  Integration of already qualified airborne systems will be primary solution sets, but if required the ruggedization of the COTs/GOTs from land or water fielded systems may be pursued.  Carbon Brakes integrates prior DoD-135/707 type brakes to the E-6B.  Seats integrates DoD approved mission seats to meet E-6B crash load requirements.  ADS-B Out integrates production COTs/GOTs to address civil navigation requirements by calendar year 2020.  Cockpit Update (CU) integrates follow on Boeing 737 and P-8A hardware to address obsolescence and additional civil navigation requirements.  Fuel Tank Sealant Upgrade (FTSU) will utilize new commercially proven and utilized processes and materials to correct fuel system leaks caused by age and operational hours.  Aircraft (AC) Electrical will integrate updated technology to the aircraft power generation and distribution system to improve power quality and distribution, and reduce aircraft weight. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Carbon brakes NRE and kit buys completed in PY; with installs in FY16-FY20 based on fleet aircraft availability.  Seats NRE completed in PY and kit buys PY-FY16; with installs in FY17-FY18 based on fleet availability.  ADS-B Out NRE completed in FY16 and kit buys FY16-FY18; with organic installs in in FY17-FY20.  CU NRE in FY16-FY19. CU A-kit buys in FY20-to beyond FYDP; B-kit buys in FY20-to beyond FYDP; with installs in FY21-to beyond FYDP.  FTSU NRE in FY17-FY18; A and B-kit buys in FY18-FY22; with installs in FY18-FY22.  Aircraft electrical NRE FY18-FY19; with A-kit buys FY20-to beyond FYDP; B-kit buys FY20-to beyond FYDP; with installs in FY21-to beyond FYDP. E-Told NRE FY17-FY18.

Name.@footnote: Other support cost in FY18-FY22 is for engineering and logistics support for SLEP Phase 1B installation.

Drive-In:: Installation Name: SLEP Phase 1B A  Kits

Name.@footnote: Non-Recurring Engineering funding in FY18 and FY19 is for CSFIRs Phase 2 and SLEP Phase 1B.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) extends the service life of the aircraft to 2038+ through airframe strengthening, structural data recording and analysis, and just in time modifications to prevent aircraft grounding due to fatigue.  Modifications include, but not limited to:  SLEP Phase 1; Individual Aircraft Tracking System (IATS); Improved Health and monitoring system, Crash Survivable Flight Incident Recorder System (CSFIRS) Phase 2; Runway Survey Analysis; and SLEP Phase 1B.  IATS will integrate the data collected from already installed Digital Flight Data Acquisition Unit (DFDAU) to support the Aircraft Structural Integrity Program.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  SLEP Phase 1 NRE completed in PY, installation kit Production buys in PY-FY18 with installs in PY-FY18.  IATS NRE FY16-FY18, kit buys and installs in FY16-FY19.  SLEP Phase 1B NRE FY17-FY18, kit buys and installs FY18 to beyond FYDP; CSFIRS Phase 2 NRE FY17-FY18, kit buys in FY19-FY21 and installs FY20-FY22.

Name.@footnote: Training cost in FY18 includes funding for MAST and WST trainers, courseware material, initial instructor training and MAST install in support of Satellite Communications (SATCOM).    Training cost in FY19 and FY20 includes funding for various trainers/courseware in support of SATCOM, CVLR and HPTS.

Name.val: 2.1.5) Wideband Satellite Communication (SATCOM) B Kits - Organic

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Communications Upgrade installs expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to improve Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operations.  Internet Protocol (IP) connectivity and wideband communication capability to enable voice, video and data services is mission critical to command and control operations.  Modifications include: IP Phase 1, International Marine/Maritime Satellite (INMARSAT); IP Phase 3, removal of Utility Trailing Wire Antenna (UTWA); Common Very Low Frequency Receiver (CVLR); High Power Transmit Set (HPTS) and integrate commercial wideband Satellite Communication (SATCOM) capability.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  IP Phase 1 production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY18. IP Phase 3 aircraft production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY18.  IP Phases 1 and 3 installations will be completed concurrently with the Block I production program in PY-FY18.  CVLR production kit buys FY19 to beyond the FYDP and production installs in FY20 to beyond FYDP.  HPTS production kit buys FY19 to beyond FYDP and installs FY20 to beyond the FYDP. Commercial Wideband SATCOM program modifies 11 aircraft SATCOM Production kit buys FY17-FY19, installs FY18-FY20.

Name.@footnote: FY18 Support Equipment is for Technology Upgrade for aircraft ground equipment.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Block I corrects Airborne Command Post (ABNCP) operational test deficiencies to improve mission capability, readiness and legacy system obsolescence.  Modifications include, but not limited to: Block I; Very Low Frequency (VLF) Transmit Terminal (VTT); and Technology Upgrade including Block, Workstations and Mission Computers. 

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  Block I Systems Integration Lab (SIL) & aircraft (A/C) development kit installed in SIL FY06 and in A/C FY08; Milestone-C 3Q FY10; Low-Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract award 3Q FY10; LRIP 1 kit buy in FY10 and 3 kit buys in FY11 with installs in FY11 and FY12 (4 A/C); Full-Rate Production (FRP) Decision Review achieved 2Q FY12.  FRP kit buys PY-FY17 (11 A/C) with installs in PY-FY18.  VTT Prototype SIL and A/C development kit delivery in FY11 with installation in FY12.  SIL and A/C testing 2Q FY12 to 1Q FY13.  VTT Production kit buys in PY-FY17 with installs in PY-FY18 (15 A/C).  Technology Upgrade Block and Technology Upgrade Workstation production and retrofit kit buys in FY16-FY17 with installs in FY17-FY18.  Technology Upgrade Mission Computer and procurement of kits in FY21 to beyond FYDP.  The installs will begin in FY22 to beyond FYDP.

Name.@footnote: Training in FY16-FY18 for upgrades to the Weapons Systems Trainer (WST) and Mission Avionics Systems Trainer (MAST) trainers and training courseware.

Other Support cost in FY18 supports mission systems testing Installation Data Package (IDP) validation and verification during associated aircraft installs, and FY19-FY21 supports the remaining installs.

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: Multi-Role Tactical Common Data Link (MR-TCDL) is an Army program which developed production hardware that will be integrated into the E-6B aircraft. The E-6B MR-TCDL program performs the NRE to integrate MR-TCDL into the E-6B to support expanded aircraft communication bandwidth capability required to interoperate with United States Strategic Command's National Command and Control Architecture.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES: E-6B MR-TCDL integration NRE PY-FY18. MR-TCDL Production A kit buys in FY16-FY20 and B Kit buys in FY16-FY19, with installs FY17-FY21.

Name.@footnote: Increase from FY17 to FY18 due to OFT procurement.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: APU A Kit

Name.@footnote: FY18 APU install decrease due to schedule slide.  ALT is predicated on FY18 kits buys only.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In:: Installation Name: APU A Kit

Description.val:
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  The Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) incorporates safety, capacity and life-limiting propulsion and power corrective actions to resolve safety and readiness concerns.  Corrections to design deficiencies found during post production test and evaluation and discovered during fleet operations that have resulted in safety and reliability degradation that must be corrected.  The requirement to upgrade or modify the APU is critical in maintaining sustainable fleet reliability, safety, and performance and is necessary to meet established mission requirements.

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  APU NRE PY-FY18, APU Kit buys PY-FY19; installations FY17-FY21

ModificationTitle.val: Family of Adv Beyond-LI-of-Sight Term/Pres&Nat'l Voice Conf (FAB-T/PNVC)(OSIP 014-14)

Other Support costs in FY18 includes engineering and logistics support production, installation, and test.  Other Support costs in FY19 includes engineering and logistics support for production, installation, and specialized enterprise-wide flight follow-on test and evaluation.  Other Support costs in FY20 includes engineering and logistics support for production and installation.

Title.val: Family of Adv Beyond-LI-of-Sight Term/Pres&Nat'l Voice Conf (FAB-T/PNVC)(OSIP 014-14)

Decrease in FAB-T B Kits unit costs is due to actual contract unit cost.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Drive In Modification:: Installation Name: FAB-T,  PNVC & RS Kit/Multiple

Description.val:
FAB-T/PNVC (014-14):
DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION:  Family of Advanced Beyond-Line-of-Sight Terminals (FAB-T) and Presidential and National Voice Conferencing (PNVC) are U.S. Air Force programs of record and will be providing production hardware to the E-6B for integration into the aircraft. These systems are an obsolescence replacement for the currently installed Military Strategic Tactical Relay terminals (MILSTAR).  E-6B integration NRE for FAB-T and PNVC includes Red Switch (RS) integration, which is required for PNVC capability.    

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:  FAB-T/PNVC NRE in FY16-FY18. FAB-T A kit buys in FY16-FY19; B kit buys in FY16-FY19; with installs in FY17-FY20.  PNVC A kit buys in FY16-FY19; B kit buys in FY16-FY19; with installs in FY17-FY20.  RS A kit buys in FY16-FY20; B kit buys in FY16-FY19; with installs in FY17-FY20.  Enterprise-wide follow-on test and evaluation in FY19-FY20.
